page.title: 20LANGWITH DRAMATIC SOCIETY.
page.content: In 1958,Les and Dorothy Salt decided to restart a Dramatic Society in Langwith.They had both been members of the St Lukes Players which had to be disbanded during the 1939-45 war.Letters were sent to anyone who might be interested in the formation of a Society and at the first meeting 41 people attended.The Langwith Dramatic Society was launched.Since it's inception 46 major plays have been performed in the Langwith Church Hall and several of them performed in halls and churches in surrounding villages.One of the most successful efforts was a variety show with many songs and sketches written by members.Sets are designed and constructed by the group and costumes are made by the members.At Christmas members tour the village singing carols collecting for childrens homes.
